input_text:
Job Title: Maintenance Supervisor - 3rd Shift

Location: York, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Be a part of momentum and innovation. Comprehensive Logistics Co., LLC is accelerating its agile diversification into new markets and expanding its current market base. You’re invited to join this company where your contributions fuel the momentum!

We are a lean company who relies on workforce talent, and in return gives you the opportunity to engage in the growing 3rd party logistics service provider market-space differentiated by our contract manufacturing process disciplines, such as integrated robotics, vision-based error-proofing and advanced IT applications in digital material flow management.

If you are energized by solving challenges, ranging from small operational details to big strategic challenges with industry changing implications, come join us.

At Comprehensive Logistics (CLI), individuals are valued for their dedication to perfecting processes and teamwork performance.

As one of the fastest growing warehousing and logistics companies in North America, we’re looking for an experienced MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR - THIRD SHIFT.

Our 3rd Shift Schedule is Monday - Thursday from 6:45pm - 6:15am with daily and weekend extensions as needed.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Supervise Maintenance Technician(s).Motivating and supervising employees.Evaluating the performance of your assigned employees, delivering positive and/or negative feedback, and addressing any shortcomings.Designing and implementing departmental policies, procedures, goals, and objectives.Responsible to install and maintain production machines and the plant facility’s equipment.Develop and maintain preventive maintenance on machines, equipment and plant facilities.Provide emergency/unscheduled repairs of production equipment during production and perform scheduled maintenance repairs of production equipment during machine service.Diagnose problems, replace or repair parts, test and adjustments.Responsible to maintain building plumbing, and carpentry functions.Performs and train mechanic skills including, but not limited to, mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, electronics, and hydraulic troubleshooting and repair of production machines.Develop, interpret and maintain equipment manuals and work orders to perform required maintenance and service.Comply with safety regulations and maintain clean and orderly work areas.Must have strong organizational skills to accurately complete and file required reports and documents and excellent communication skills and the ability to work well with others.Understand federal, state and local codes and regulations.Ability to perform work independently.

REQUIRED EDUCATION, CERTIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCES:

High school diploma/GEDElectrician Journeyman Card and completion of a craft apprenticeship, or an equivalent number of years of education and production maintenance experience preferred5 (+) years of manufacturing maintenance experience; strong PLC, pneumatic, mechanical, electrical/electronic, and industrial skills with some HVACUse a variety of hand and power tools, electric meters, and material handling/ mobile equipment in performing duties.Computer skills, preferably Microsoft Office Suites, Outlook, RFID scanning equipment

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to fumes or airborne particles, coolant and oils, moving mechanical parts and vibration. In addition, the employee is periodically exposed to elevated heights.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

The physical requirements for this job directly reflect the essential functions necessary to be successful in this position. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to speak and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing and sitting throughout the day. The employee must frequently lift and/or move items over 75 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. The employee will also need to adjust to changes in temperature and noise level.

Comprehensive Logistics Co., LLC is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Maintenance Supervisor - 3rd Shift
output_json.summary: Join Comprehensive Logistics Co., LLC, a fast-growing warehousing and logistics company, as a Maintenance Supervisor.
job_responsibilities: Maintaining building plumbing and carpentry functions
Troubleshooting and repair of production machines
Developing, interpreting, and maintaining equipment manuals and work orders
Maintaining clean and orderly work areas
output_json.physical_requirements: Frequent exposure to fumes, airborne particles, coolant/oils, moving mechanical parts, vibration, elevated heights
output_json.company_information: Comprehensive Logistics Co., LLC is a fast-growing warehousing and logistics company with a focus on contract manufacturing process disciplines.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Comprehensive Logistics Co., LLC is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
